input:
Textual context: Anne is furry. Anne is smart. Bob is kind. Bob is nice. Charlie is big. Charlie is green. Charlie is nice. Charlie is young. Gary is furry. Gary is kind. Gary is nice. Gary is young. If something is young then it is nice. If Anne is green then Anne is big. Smart things are nice. All smart, kind things are green. Young, big things are kind. Kind, smart things are furry. If something is nice and big then it is young. All nice things are kind. If Anne is young and Anne is big then Anne is nice.
Question: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or unknown? Anne is kind.
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop

axiom A1 : Furry Anne
axiom A2 : Smart Anne
axiom A3 : Kind Bob
axiom A4 : Nice Bob
axiom A5 : Big Charlie
axiom A6 : Green Charlie
axiom A7 : Nice Charlie
axiom A8 : Young Charlie
axiom A9 : Furry Gary
axiom A10 : Kind Gary
axiom A11 : Nice Gary
axiom A12 : Young Gary

-- Rule R1: If something is young then it is nice
axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Young x → Nice x

-- Rule R2: If Anne is green then Anne is big
axiom R2 : Green Anne → Big Anne

-- Rule R3: Smart things are nice
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Nice x

-- Rule R4: All smart, kind things are green
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x ∧ Kind x → Green x

-- Rule R5: Young, big things are kind
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Young x ∧ Big x → Kind x

-- Rule R6: Kind, smart things are furry
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Smart x → Furry x

-- Rule R7: If something is nice and big then it is young
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x ∧ Big x → Young x

-- Rule R8: All nice things are kind
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Kind x

-- Rule R9: If Anne is young and big then Anne is nice
axiom R9 : Young Anne ∧ Big Anne → Nice Anne

theorem kind_Anne : Kind Anne :=
begin
  apply R8,
  apply R3,
  exact A2,
end

-- Looks like the theorem can be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Anne is not kind

theorem not_kind_Anne : ¬ Kind Anne :=
begin
  have H1 : Smart Anne := A2,
  have H2 : Kind Anne → Furry Anne := λ h, R6 Anne (and.intro h H1),
  have H3 : Furry Anne := A1,
  by_contradiction,
  push_neg at a,
  have H4 : Kind Anne := H2 a,
  contradiction,
  sorry,
end

-- The negation of the theorem can not be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is True
